Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Reliant Processing has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Reliant Processing now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a “living document”. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Reliant Processing employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Reliant Processing will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Reliant Processing has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Reliant Processing’s emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans – Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements] – Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 40 CFR §68.95
= Federal “Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response” (HAZWOPER) – Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Strategically, we will respond “minimally” to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 
Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Reliant Processing has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Reliant Processing continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Reliant Processing’s ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Reliant Processing’s management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Reliant Processing has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical in

The refrigeration system employed at Reliant Processing is configured for flooded operation. 

Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Reliant Processing consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Reliant Processing is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Reliant Processing has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Reliant Processing facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 16,000 lb of anhydrous ammonia. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist

ess to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

Reliant Processing operates a carbon dioxide (CO2) distribution plant in Galva, IA that purifies and liquifies a high pressure CO2 stream. To maximize the efficiency of the liquefaction, the facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

Exchanger E-1 (CO2 Desuperheater)
Exchanger E-3 (CO2 Precooler)
Exchanger E-4 (CO2 Desuperheater)
Exchanger E-5/15 (CO2 Chiller)
Exchanger E-6B (CO2 Auxiliary Reboiler)
Exchanger E-7 (CO2 Condenser)
Exchanger E-8 (CO2 Vent Condenser)
Exchanger E-9 (Subcooler)
Exchanger E-17 (CO2 Condenser)
Exchanger PH-5 (CO2 Heater)
Exchanger PH-6 (CO2 Regen Gas Heater)

Facility Location

Reliant Processing is located at 1584 Market Ave, Galva, IA 51020. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 42.477441, -95.415537. The facility is located approximately 1,000 feet south of state highway 20 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

Flood Hazards

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in “an area of minimal flood hazard”.

Seismic Susceptibility

A review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Reliant Processing has a <1% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.

Description of Covered Process

Flooded System

The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

Most control valve groups are located adjacent to the equipment to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Reliant Processing has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Reliant Processing, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Reliant Processing has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                       | Process Chemical                | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration       Anhydrous Ammonia           16,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
